gurmukhi: Aaur geI suD BUl sBY kib sXwm iehI rs BIqr pwgXo ]vwr khXo sB hI hY suKI sun ky bqIXw suK BXo duK BwgXo ]1012]
transliteration: Aur Gadsudh Bhool Sabhai Kabi Syaam Ehiras Bheetar Paagyo|| Vaah Kahyo Sabh Hihai Soukhitoun Ke Bateeyaa Soukh Bhyo Doukh Bhaagyo||1012||
translation: Vidura was absorbed so much in the affectionate talk about Krishna that he forgot about any other matter; knowing about the welfare of all, he blessed them; he obtained great comfort ending his anxiety.1012.

gurmukhi: kyl krY mQurw mY soaU mn qy kho hau biRjnwQ ibswrI ]du`Kq BI ien logn qy Aiq hI kih kY Gin sXwm pukwrI ]
transliteration: Kel Darai Mathuraa Mai Sooo Man Te Kaho Hau Brijnaath Bisdaree|| Doukkhat Bhiin Dogad Te At(i) Hikai Ghan(i) Syaam Poukdaree||
translation: “Krishna is absorbed in his plays in Mathura and has forgotten me,” Kunti said in a loud voice, “I have been greatly aggrieved by the behaviours of the people (Kaurvas) of this place;

gurmukhi: nwQ mrXo suq bwl rhy iqh qy AkRUr BXo duKu BwrI ]qw qy hau pUCq hau kau kbhUM hir jI suD lyhu hmwrI ]1013]
transliteration: Naath Daryo Sout Baal Rahe Tih Te Akroor Bhayo Doukh(u) Bhdaree|| Taa Te Hau Kau Kabdhoondhar(i) Jisudh Lehu Hamdaree||1013||
translation: “My husband has passed away and the children are still minor; therefore, O Akrur ! I am in great agony and ask you whether Krishna will also communicate with us.1013.

gurmukhi: du`Kq hÍY AkRUr ky sMg khI bqIXw niRp AMD irsY sy ]dyq hY duKu Gno hm kau kihXo sun mIq isAwm so AYsy ]
transliteration: Doukhat Hvai Akroor Ke San Kahibateeyaa Nrip Andh Risai Se|| Det Hai Doukh(u) Ghano Ham Kau Kahiyo Soun Meet Siaam So Aise||
translation: “The blind king Dhritrashtra is angry with us,” this was told by Kunti to Akrur and said further, “O Akrur ! please tell Krishna that all of them are agonising us;

gurmukhi: pwrQ BRwq rcy aunko nih vwih khXo khu so ibD kYsy ]XoN suin auqr dyq BeI soaU AwNK ky bIc pry qiRx jYsy ]1014]
transliteration: Paarath Bhraat Rache Ounko Nah(i) Vaah(i) Kahyo Kahu So Bidh Kaise|| Yon Soun(i) Outar Det Bhaisooo Aankh Ke Beech Ke Beech Dare Trin Jaise||1014||
translation: “Arjuna considers all of them as brother-like, but they do not respond likewise; how should I describe my anguish?” And saying thus, the tears rolled down from the eyes of Kunti as if some straw was troubling her eye.1014.

gurmukhi: kihXo ibnqI hmrI hir so Aiq Sok smuMdR mY bUf geI hau ]jIvq hoN kib sXwm khY quih Awiem pwie kY nwm keI hau ]
transliteration: Kahiyo Bintihamrihar(i) So At(i) Shok Samounndra Mai Bood Gadhau|| Jeevat Hon Kabi Syaam Kahai Tuhe Aais Paae Kai Naam Kaihau||
translation: “O Akrur ! tell Krishna that I have been drowned in the ocean of sorrow and am living only on your name and best wishes;

gurmukhi: mwrn mo suq kO niRp ky suq kot aupwvn so kFeI hau ]sXwm soN XoN khIXo bqIXwN qumry ibn nwQ AnwQ BeI hau ]1015]
transliteration: Maaran Mo Sout Kau Nrip Ke Sout Kot Oupaavan So Kadhaihau|| Syaam Son Yon Kaheeyo Bateeyaan Toumre Bin Naath Anaath Bhaihau||1015||
translation: “The sons of the king are making great efforts to kill my sons; O Akrur! tell Krishna that without him we are all helpless.”1015.

gurmukhi: XoN kihkY iqh so bqIXw Aiq hI duK sws ausws su lIno ]jo duK mory irdY mih Qo soaU mY qum pY sB hI kih dIno ]
transliteration: Yon Kah(i)kai Tih So Bateeyaa At(i) Hidoukh Saas Ousaas Su Leeno|| Jo Doukh More Ridai Maih Tho Sooo Mai Toum Pai Sabh Hikah(i) Deeno||
translation: Saying this, Kunti heaved a long and sorrowful sigh and said further, “Whatever anguish I had in my heart, I have disclosed that;

gurmukhi: so sunIXY hmrI ibrQw khIXo duK kI jdubIr hTIno ]hy biRjnwQ AnwQn nwQ mhwie kro kir rodn kIno ]1016]
transliteration: So Souneeyai Harmribirthaa Kaheeyo Doukh Kijadoubeer Hatheeno|| He Brijnaath Anaathan Naath Sahaae Daro Kar(i) Rodan Keeno||1016||
translation: “O Akrur ! the hero of the Yadavas ! you may please tell all my painful story to Krishna,” and again lamenting she said, ‘O the Lord of Braja ! kindly help the poor creatures like us.’ “1016.
